name: Pilot Light
description:
IMPORTANT! Please read the install instructions before playing!

This was an 8 week long project for a class in which we learned the basics of making games in Unreal. As such, there are some limitations in the presentation and game play - I'm still learning!

There is no start menu or pause menu  - you just load in and start playing. You can quit the game by hitting the escape key. I'd like to polish the game further as time goes on and add these things in, so consider this a kind of prototype!

If you find any game breaking issues or aesthetic mistakes (things clipping through other things, trees and plants in places they don't belong), please drop me a note/screenshot so I can fix it. I hope you have fun playing!

Game made in UE4 4.24.2.
Background music was made by me using BoscaCeoil.
All meshes were modeled by me using Maya (save for the skull and various bones).
The skull, bones, some textures, and particle effects are from giorgigedianidze's Low-Poly Mesh VFX.
The ocean texture and a few others were modified from LXXVII's Low Poly Water pack.
Damage sound effects and NPC voices come from myself. All other sounds come from Soundsnap.
